lender.name: David Y. Seetiangtham
lender.loan_because: I believe in microcredit and I believe that Kiva is the most effective way for me to contribute to giving microcredit loans to people who need it. You should never give away money blindly to an NGO. I encourage lenders and will-be-lenders to research constructive criticism against Kiva. An example of criticism that has been constructive and thus led to more transparency in the way Kiva portrays itself can be found here: http://blogs.cgdev.org/open_book/2009/10/kiva-is-not-quite-what-it-seems.php
lender.occupational_info: I study development studies and Japanese at The University of Bergen in Norway.

lender.name: Raj & Kshipra

lender.loan_because: I will give women in developing countries an opportunity to start their own business. If you help the women, you help the whole community.

lender.name: Sparky Firepants
lender.loan_because:
Long ago I decided to put a certain percentage of my revenue toward improving the world.
The best way for me to do do this right now is by lending capital to assist those who have the drive to start their own businesses. Kiva allows me to do that on a global scale.
The money isn't a handout, it's a loan. That's important to me. Besides, when a person pays off their loan, I put it right into someone else's business. I decide where the money goes and I can track progress, so it feels much different than blindly sending a check and hoping for the best.
lender.occupational_info: I create fresh, on-target illustration for fun people. My art goes on products, textiles, magazines and marketing materials.

lender.name: Harit Patel
lender.loan_because: I want to help other people.

lender.name: Mats
lender.loan_because: I want to help entrepreneurs and people who are working toward their own goals.

lender.occupational_info: I come up with creative solutions to problems.

lender.name: Danny
lender.loan_because: It is the most efficient way to reduce poverty

lender.name: Kurt
lender.loan_because: A small amount of money, loaned at virtually no risk, can truly change the world.

lender.occupational_info: I have been an entrepreneur for over 30 years. I have done many different things but primarily I have provided low income housing that allowed those less fortunate to live with dignity.

lender.occupational_info: I help to install electronic equipment in schools and government agencies in the U.S., for a small company. We are small, so we hope that we can help other businesses that are struggling like us. I am also a chef sometimes.

lender.name: Group Funds
lender.loan_because: UPDATE: Due to the recent tragedy in Haiti, Gene's daughters have decided to withdraw 60% of the group funds to help send relief to the people of Haiti. Because of Gene's compassion for the innocence of children, his daughters have chosen Save the Children to receive this charitable donation. The girls have also decided to matched the funds withdrawn from Kiva to make a total donation of $1,600. Gene's daughters will continue loaning funds through Kiva .org indefinitely and hope to rebuild and grow the account in the near future.
lender.occupational_info: Save the Children is not only providing and distributing the basics to the people and children of Haiti, they are setting up Child Friendly Spaces planned for shelters and camps housing earthquake victims. These safe spaces protect children and give them a place to play and recover from the suffering they have endured and witnessed.

lender.name: Bekah
lender.occupational_info: I study the body's immune system response to cancer.

lender.name: Peter & Verena
lender.loan_because:
We want to make a difference.
In Europe we have a good life. In other countries it's not so easy.
It is a sad fact that we cannot wait for governments to change the world. Kiva has empowered you and us to do this.
So please. Make a difference. Join kiva today.
lender.occupational_info: Verena works in a legal office. Peter works in a bank.

lender.name: Joel
lender.loan_because: I am
lender.occupational_info: Helping people find information to better themselves

lender.name: Gaylin
lender.loan_because: Someone did something nice for me when I had no source of food. They wouldn't take repayment, so I'm paying it forward.
lender.occupational_info: I'm a writer of all kinds of things. I write to make people feel something. I write to put food on my table. And I write because it's part of me.

lender.name: Bryan
lender.loan_because: It just feeels soo gooood!!!
lender.occupational_info: I assist Kiva in ensuring the loans on the website are in good faith and do not have false information and I help keep lenders up date on the progress and impact of their loans.

lender.name: Mary
lender.loan_because: I want to make a difference in worthwhile causes and am excited to be a part of the outcome of my projects.
lender.occupational_info: I am a retired classical piano instructor. I currently am a musician and vocalist at my Catholic Church.

lender.name: Clarus Health
lender.occupation: Medical Education and Health Care Consulting

lender.name: Emma
lender.loan_because: Loans have helped me out in the past. I think I should pay it forward.
lender.occupational_info: I help children and teenagers understand mathematics.

lender.name: evelyn
lender.loan_because: i'd like to think it makes a difference in the world.
lender.occupational_info: i help physicians follow government regulations regarding privacy and documentation of services.

lender.name: Rogers Adventist School
lender.loan_because: We are the healers and helpers of tomorrow. Kiva has given us a way to start today.
lender.occupational_info: We're a Christian learning community, for children 5-14 years old. We want to make a difference in our world.

lender.name: max
lender.loan_because: It helps me to share in hope for a fairer and just world.

lender.name: Jay Bain
lender.loan_because: I am truly inspired by the hard working entrepeneurs I've found and supported via Kiva. Respectfully helping individuals and their families succeed with their own dreams is a great feeling. Great idea and website!
lender.occupational_info: I'm an experienced project manager in the digital advertising and mobile UX design and development field. I've also built art bicycles and love being a dedicated father to my son Milo and committed partner to my wife Shiho.

lender.name: Joseph
lender.loan_because: Wilson told me to.

lender.name: Alaia Leighland
lender.loan_because: It is My desire to give a Hand up - Not a "Hand Out" I feel that if my money can help another small business owner get a foothold it is beneficial to me and to them.
lender.occupational_info: I have a small store front in Hawaii where tourist buy the jewelry and household souvenir items as keepsakes. I teach other business owners how to create and package saleable goods. It gives me great pleasure to be able to help others to create sustainability through the opportunity offered by Kiva micro -finance. I sell used books at on line and use the money to fund my kiva loans. I am proud of the groups that I have assisted so far and thanks to my sales, and my Running for "Change" there are many more to come.

lender.name: Cardinal
lender.loan_because: I think there should be a good beer everywhere.

lender.name: Richard
lender.loan_because: I was inspired by the good deeds of this program
lender.occupational_info: I have had a good life as a professor, and now that I am retired, I have hope to bring this joy to others

lender.name: Andrea
lender.loan_because: cynicism isn't productive.

lender.name: John
lender.loan_because: To help other people.
lender.occupational_info: I loan money for mortgages.
